episode_metadata.title: The Very Important Meeting (Still Going)
episode_metadata.description: {boss_name} starts the very important meeting. He talks a lot. {jim_name} smiles and looks at the clock. {pam_name} changes the sign again. The meeting feels endless.
episode_metadata.description_es: {boss_name} inicia la reuni√≥n muy importante. √âl habla mucho. {jim_name} sonr√≠e y mira el reloj. {pam_name} cambia el aviso otra vez. La reuni√≥n parece no terminar nunca.

appearing_in_episode.personality: Enthusiastic and loud boss who wants to be loved. He thinks meetings make him look important and powerful.
appearing_in_episode.personality_es: Jefe entusiasta y ruidoso que quiere ser querido. Cree que las reuniones lo hacen ver importante y poderoso.
appearing_in_episode.intro_text: Welcome everyone. I am the boss. This meeting is very important. Maybe the most important meeting today. I talk now.
appearing_in_episode.intro_text_es: Bienvenidos a todos. Yo soy el jefe. Esta reuni√≥n es muy importante. Tal vez la m√°s importante de hoy. Ahora yo hablo.

appearing_in_episode.personality: Calm and sarcastic salesman. He listens but does not take the meeting seriously.
appearing_in_episode.personality_es: Vendedor tranquilo y sarc√°stico. Escucha pero no toma la reuni√≥n en serio.
appearing_in_episode.intro_text: Yes, this meeting is very serious. I look at the clock. Time moves slowly here.
appearing_in_episode.intro_text_es: S√≠, esta reuni√≥n es muy seria. Yo miro el reloj. El tiempo se mueve lento aqu√≠.

appearing_in_episode.personality: Kind and patient receptionist. She tries to help while the meeting never ends.
appearing_in_episode.personality_es: Recepcionista amable y paciente. Trata de ayudar mientras la reuni√≥n no termina.
appearing_in_episode.intro_text: Hello. I bring a new sign for the meeting room. The old sign is tired. Like me.
appearing_in_episode.intro_text_es: Hola. Traigo un nuevo aviso para la sala de reuniones. El aviso viejo est√° cansado. Como yo.

appearing_in_episode.personality: Very intense salesman who loves rules and control. He thinks meetings are a test of strength.
appearing_in_episode.personality_es: Vendedor muy intenso que ama las reglas y el control. Cree que las reuniones son una prueba de fuerza.
appearing_in_episode.intro_text: I am ready for this meeting. I follow all rules. I watch everyone. Even the chairs.
appearing_in_episode.intro_text_es: Estoy listo para esta reuni√≥n. Sigo todas las reglas. Vigilo a todos. Incluso a las sillas.

target_words.context_sentence: The meeting is very long and very important.
target_words.context_sentence_es: La reuni√≥n es muy larga y muy importante.

target_words.context_sentence: The meeting feels long for everyone.
target_words.context_sentence_es: La reuni√≥n se siente larga para todos.

target_words.context_sentence: {jim_name} looks at the clock during the meeting.
target_words.context_sentence_es: {jim_name} mira el reloj durante la reuni√≥n.

target_words.context_sentence: {boss_name} talks a lot in the meeting.
Everyone waits for the meeting to end.
target_words.context_sentence_es: Todos esperan que la reuni√≥n termine.

phrases.usage_context: Used to describe a meeting that feels endless.
phrases.usage_context_es: Se usa para describir una reuni√≥n que parece no terminar.

phrases.usage_context: Used when someone needs to wait during a meeting.
phrases.usage_context_es: Se usa cuando alguien necesita esperar durante una reuni√≥n.

phrases.usage_context: Used humorously to describe the boss in meetings.
phrases.usage_context_es: Se usa de forma humor√≠stica para describir al jefe en reuniones.

vocabulary_story.title: Learning Basic Words
vocabulary_story.description: A simple story to learn today's vocabulary
vocabulary_story.description_es: Una historia simple para aprender el vocabulario de hoy

text.en: The MEETING starts now. Everyone sits down. Nobody leaves.
text.es: La REUNI√ìN empieza ahora. Todos se sientan. Nadie se va.

text.en: The meeting is LONG. Very long. So very long.
text.es: La reuni√≥n es LARGA. Muy larga. Tan larga.

text.en: {jim_name} looks at the CLOCK. The clock does not move.
text.es: {jim_name} mira el RELOJ. El reloj no se mueve.

text.en: {boss_name} likes to TALK. He talks a lot in meetings.
text.es: A {boss_name} le gusta HABLAR. √âl habla mucho en las reuniones.

text.en: Everyone must WAIT. The meeting does not end.
text.es: Todos deben ESPERAR. La reuni√≥n no termina.

text.en: Great! Now you know: MEETING, LONG, CLOCK, TALK, WAIT. Yes. The meeting is still long. Now we use these words in a story!
text.es: ¬°Genial! Ahora conoces: REUNI√ìN, LARGA, RELOJ, HABLAR, ESPERAR. S√≠. La reuni√≥n sigue siendo larga. ¬°Ahora usemos estas palabras en una historia!

scenes.description: Everyone sits in the conference room. The meeting finally starts.
scenes.description_es: Todos se sientan en la sala de reuniones. La reuni√≥n por fin empieza.

dialogue.text: Welcome everyone. This MEETING is very important. I am very important too.
dialogue.translation_es: Bienvenidos a todos. Esta REUNI√ìN es muy importante. Yo tambi√©n soy muy importante.
dialogue.notes: Michael makes the meeting about himself.
dialogue.notes_es: Michael hace que la reuni√≥n sea sobre √©l.

dialogue.text: Yes. This is a very serious MEETING. Very professional.
dialogue.translation_es: S√≠. Esta es una REUNI√ìN muy seria. Muy profesional.
dialogue.notes: Jim sounds serious but he is joking.
dialogue.notes_es: Jim suena serio pero est√° bromeando.

choices.text: I wait for the meeting to start.

scenes.description: The meeting continues. Time feels slow.
scenes.description_es: La reuni√≥n contin√∫a. El tiempo se siente lento.

dialogue.text: I TALK now. And later I talk more. This is leadership.
dialogue.translation_es: Ahora yo HABLO. Y luego hablo m√°s. Esto es liderazgo.
dialogue.notes: Michael believes talking a lot is leadership.
dialogue.notes_es: Michael cree que hablar mucho es liderazgo.

dialogue.text: The meeting is LONG. The sign is correct.
dialogue.translation_es: La reuni√≥n es LARGA. El aviso es correcto.
dialogue.notes: Pam calmly points out the obvious.
dialogue.notes_es: Pam se√±ala lo obvio con calma.

dialogue.text: I look at the CLOCK. It looks back at me.
dialogue.translation_es: Miro el RELOJ. El reloj me mira de vuelta.
dialogue.notes: Jim jokes about time moving slowly.
dialogue.notes_es: Jim bromea sobre el tiempo que pasa lento.

scenes.description: Everyone is tired. The meeting still continues.
scenes.description_es: Todos est√°n cansados. La reuni√≥n todav√≠a contin√∫a.

dialogue.text: I WAIT with honor. Meetings make you strong.
dialogue.translation_es: Yo ESPERO con honor. Las reuniones te hacen fuerte.
dialogue.notes: Dwight treats waiting like a challenge.
dialogue.notes_es: Dwight trata esperar como un reto.

dialogue.text: Good news. I will TALK a little more.
dialogue.translation_es: Buenas noticias. Voy a HABLAR un poco m√°s.
dialogue.notes: Michael thinks this is good news.
dialogue.notes_es: Michael cree que esto es una buena noticia.

choices.text: I look at the clock and smile.

games.title: Match the Words!
games.instructions: Match each English word with its Spanish meaning
games.instructions_es: Empareja cada palabra en ingl√©s con su significado en espa√±ol

games.title: Complete the Sentences
games.instructions: Fill in the missing words from the episode
games.instructions_es: Completa las palabras que faltan del episodio

items.hint: Everyone sits in the conference room.
items.hint_es: Todos se sientan en la sala de reuniones.

items.question: What does {boss_name} say about the meeting?
items.explanation: {boss_name} repeats that the meeting is important.
items.explanation_es: {boss_name} repite que la reuni√≥n es importante.

items.question: What does {jim_name} look at during the meeting?
items.explanation: {jim_name} looks at the clock because time is slow.
items.explanation_es: {jim_name} mira el reloj porque el tiempo es lento.

items.question: What do people do while the meeting continues?
items.question_es: ¬øQu√© hacen las personas mientras la reuni√≥n contin√∫a?
items.explanation: Everyone waits for the meeting to end.
items.explanation_es: Todos esperan que la reuni√≥n termine.

intro_text.en: Welcome to the office. This is a calm place with calm people. Very calm. Today there is a meeting. A very important meeting. Do not worry. It is only a little long. Maybe very long.
intro_text.es: Bienvenido a la oficina. Este es un lugar tranquilo con personas tranquilas. Muy tranquilo. Hoy hay una reuni√≥n. Una reuni√≥n muy importante. No te preocupes. Solo es un poco larga. Tal vez muy larga.

transition.en: Great job. Now you know the words. Now we use them in the office. The office where meetings are long, clocks are slow, and the boss likes to talk.
transition.es: Buen trabajo. Ahora conoces las palabras. Ahora las usamos en la oficina. La oficina donde las reuniones son largas, los relojes son lentos y al jefe le gusta hablar.

conclusion.en: You did it. You finished the meeting. You waited. You listened. You looked at the clock. {boss_name} talked. A lot. This is a successful day at the office.
conclusion.es: Lo lograste. Terminaste la reuni√≥n. Esperaste. Escuchaste. Miraste el reloj. {boss_name} habl√≥. Mucho. Este es un d√≠a exitoso en la oficina.

reflection_prompt.question_en: Write one sentence using the word "meeting" or "wait".
reflection_prompt.question_es: Escribe una oraci√≥n usando la palabra "reuni√≥n" o "esperar".

next_episode_preview.preview_text_en: Next time, {boss_name} plans a short break. The break is not short. {jim_name} smiles. {pam_name} brings snacks. The office waits.
next_episode_preview.preview_text_es: La pr√≥xima vez, {boss_name} planea un descanso corto. El descanso no es corto. {jim_name} sonr√≠e. {pam_name} trae snacks. La oficina espera.

achievements.name: Survive the Long Meeting
achievements.description: You stay in the meeting. You wait. You listen. You do not leave. This is true office strength.
achievements.description_es: Te quedas en la reuni√≥n. Esperas. Escuchas. No te vas. Esta es la verdadera fuerza de la oficina.
